alert.note: Alert for Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 6:53AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL MARIPOSA AND NORTHEASTERN MADERA COUNTIES THROUGH 730 AM PDT... At 652 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Yosemite South Entrance, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Yosemite South Entrance, Fish Camp, Merced Lake High Sierra Camp, Wawona, Ostrander Lake, Mariposa Grove, Wawona Vistor Center, and Buck Camp Ranger Station. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley
